it.unisa.diem.softwareengineering.assignment2021

Class ComplexNumber

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unisa.diem.softwareengineering.assignment2021.ComplexNumber

  • public class ComplexNumber
extends java.lang.Object
    A representation of a Complex Number that with a real part and an imaginary part.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ComplexNumber(java.lang.Double real, java.lang.Double imm)
      Creates a new Complex Number, while checking if its digits aren't too big or if number passed is NaN.

      • ComplexNumber

        public ComplexNumber(java.lang.Double real,
                     java.lang.Double imm)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new Complex Number, while checking if its digits aren't too big or if number passed is NaN.
        Parameters:
        real - the real part of the complex number.
        imm - the immaginary part of the complex number.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when either real or imm have too many digits, they're Infinite or they're NaN.

      • parseToComplexNumber

        public static ComplexNumber parseToComplexNumber(java.lang.String str)
                                          throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        A method to convert a properly formatted String to a Complex Number. Accepted formats are: a+bj, a+jb, jb+a, bj+a, a, j. Where a and b are strings parsable to Double.
        Parameters:
        str - The string to parse to a complex number.
        Returns:
        ComplexNumber the complex number corresponding to the parsed string
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - When str doesn't have the correct format, so it can't be covnerted.
